properties.publicTransport: Tickets include travel on transport. Express trains and major event buses will run. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
FIFA Women’s World Cup™: Final at Stadium Australia in Sydney Olympic Park. Kick off at 8.30pm. Finish approx 10.30pm subject to extra time and penalties.

With up to 80,000 fans significant traffic delays are expected. Fans are urged to leave the car at home and catch transport.

Motorists should expect delays and allow plenty of extra travel time on roads approaching Olympic Park including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

  • If you have to drive, it’s essential to pre-book parking online in advance to secure a space available until 11:59pm the night before the game unless sold out prior.
  • Note P1 car park next to Stadium Australia is sold out on this match day and will only be available to fans holding a FIFA-endorsed vehicle access pass. Limited parking is available to pre-book at other nearby car parks within the precinct but will fill quickly. If you have pre-booked, follow the directions of staff and have your parking ticket ready to show at the car park entry. If you're driving from the north, use Silverwater Rd, Holker St and Hill Rd to access to precinct car parks and avoid heavy traffic expected on Homebush Bay Drive and Underwood Rd. 

Local roads within Sydney Olympic Park will close from the night before and reopen the morning after the game. See the Sydney Olympic Park road closure map for details. Allow extra time and follow the directions of traffic controllers on site.

arrangementElements.html:
See the Sydney Olympic Park road closure map for details.

properties.publicTransport: Travel on transport is included in match tickets. Frequent light rail and buses will run. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
FIFA Women’s World Cup™: Round of 16 at Sydney Football Stadium. Kick-off at 12pm, finish approx 2pm (subject to extra time and penalties).

With up to 40,000 fans expected significant traffic delays are expected on roads in the area. Motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time on roads approaching and around Moore Park including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

Both grass car parks on Driver Ave will not be open to the public on match days. Parking in the precinct is extremely limited. If you have to drive, carpool with your group and plan to arrive early. Parking is available in Entertainment Quarter Wilson car park, Sydney Boys & Girls High School on Cleveland St and off-site parking will be available at Royal Randwick Racecourse (entry via Ascot St).

Local closures will be in place to safely manage crowds:

  • Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 9am and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area after the game.
  • The Moore Park Rd and Fitzroy St cycleway will temporarily close from 9am to 4pm before, during and after the game.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 8am to 4pm on sections of Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Chalmers St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St. Clearways will also be in effect on both sides of Driver Ave between Moore Park Rd and Lang Rd for the entire day on match days from 12.01am to 11.59pm.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

arrangementElements.html:
Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

SURRY HILLS / MOORE PARK

8am to 4pm:

  • Albion Street between Bourke Street and Flinders Street (both sides)
  • Cleveland Street between South Dowling Street and City Road (both sides)
  • Flinders Street between Albion Street and Moore Park Road (eastern side)
  • Fitzroy Street between South Dowling Street and Bourke Street (northern side)
  • Foveaux Street between Bourke Street and Crown Street (northern side)
  • Lang Road between Cook Road and Anzac Parade (both sides)
  • Moore Park Road between Driver Avenue and Anzac Parade (southern side)
  • Moore Park Road between Flinders Street and Greens Road (northern side)
  • Moore Park Road between Cook Road and Poate Road (southern side)

From 8am to 1pm: Chalmers Street between Cleveland Street and Randle Street (western side)

24-hour clearways: both sides of Driver Avenue between Moore Park Road and Lang Road for the entire day on match days from 12.01am to 11.59pm.

Declaration under Major Events Act 2009 – FIFA Women’s World Cup™ 2023 – Effective from 10 July 2023

I, Steve Cox, Chief Executive Officer of Destination NSW being the Responsible Authority for the FIFA Women’s World Cup 2023 as defined by the Major Events Act 2009 and Major Events Regulation 2017, declare that for the whole of the Major Event Period, section 143 of the Road Transport Act 2013 applies to any unattended motor vehicles or trailers that are parked on roads or otherwise notified as a part of the major event route or in restricted parking areas (including areas designated as a towaway area or Special Event Clearway) all of which are specified at transportnsw.info/fifa-wwc in the same way as it applies to an unattended motor vehicle or trailer unlawfully standing on a prescribed place within the meaning of that section. Removal of any vehicles that are standing unlawfully, constituting a danger to persons or property, or causing an obstruction will be undertaken in accordance with section 143 of the Road Transport Act 2013.
arrangementElements.title: Special Event Clearways

FIFA Women’s World Cup™: Panama v France at Sydney Football Stadium. Kick-off at 8pm, finish approx 10pm.

With up to 40,000 fans expected significant traffic delays are expected on roads in the area during the already busy evening peak. Motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time on roads approaching and around Moore Park including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

Both grass car parks on Driver Ave will not be open to the public on match days. Parking in the precinct is extremely limited. If you have to drive, carpool with your group and plan to arrive early. Parking is available in Entertainment Quarter Wilson car park, Sydney Boys & Girls High School on Cleveland St and off-site parking will be available at Royal Randwick Racecourse (entry via Ascot St).

Local closures will be in place to safely manage crowds:

  • Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 5pm and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area after the game.
  • The Eastern Distributor Off-Ramp to Moore Park Road (Bondi Exit) will close from 9.30pm to 11pm. 
  • The Moore Park Rd and Fitzroy St cycleway will temporarily close from 5pm to midnight before, during and after the game

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 3pm to midnight on sections of Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Chalmers St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St. Clearways will also be in effect on both sides of Driver Ave between Moore Park Rd and Lang Rd for the entire day on match days from 12.01am to 11.59pm.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

24-hour clearways: both sides of Driver Avenue between Moore Park Road and Lang Road for the entire day on match days from 12.01am to 11.59pm.

properties.displayName: FIFA Women’s World Cup™: Panama v France

roads.mainStreet: Moore Park Road, Anzac Parade, Lang Road, Eastern Distributor

properties.publicTransport: L1 Light rail services run regularly to Exhibition Centre and Paddys Markets within walking distance of Tumbalong Park. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
All FIFA Women’s World Cup™ Australia and New Zealand tournament matches will also be streamed live on the big screen at Sydney’s FIFA Fan Festival™ in Tumbalong Park, Darling Harbour. Cheer on your team while also enjoying an exciting football and entertainment programme during the tournament.

Opening Dates* subject to change:

  • Thursday 20th July – Thursday 3rd August
  • Saturday 5th – Tuesday 8th August
  • Friday 11th – Saturday 12th August
  • Tuesday 15th – Wednesday 16th August
  • Saturday 19th – Sunday 20th August

Fans are encouraged to catch public transport.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads throughout the Sydney CBD.

NRLW: Sharks v Titans at PointsBet Stadium in Woolooware. Kick-off from 3:10pm and full time around 5pm.

Road closures will be in place on Captain Cook Drive from approximately 10 minutes before kick off and remain in place until crowds have cleared after full-time.

Traffic on roads approaching the stadium may be heavier than usual including Captain Cook Dr, Woolooware Rd and Gannons Rd. 

Motorists in the area should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.

Stakes Day at Rosehill Gardens Racecourse. First race at 11:15am, last race from 4:55pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on James Ruse Dr and Hassall St as attendees arrive and leave the racecourse.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads in the area.

properties.publicTransport: Routes 549, 550, 600, 601 and 606 will be diverting and using different stops while the road closures are in place at the end of the game. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

properties.otherAdvice:
NRL Eels double header. NRLW v Knights kick-off at 12pm. Nrl v Dragons kick-off at 2pm, finish around 4pm.

Heavy traffic is expected on roads approaching and within Parramatta as fans travel to the game. Motorists should allow extra travel time on Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd, James Ruse Dr and Pennant Hills Rd. Motorists should also exercise caution as pedestrian activity will be high on roads between Parramatta Interchange and the stadium.

Roads outside the stadium will close from approximately 3:35pm to 4:15pm to allow crowds to safely leave the venue. Roads will re-open once crowds have cleared the area. 

  • O’Connell Street from Grose Street to George Street
  • Ross Street from O’Connell Street to Trott Street
  • Victoria Road from O’Connell Street to Villiers Street

Fans should follow the directions of traffic controllers and NSW Police and allow extra time when exiting car parks. If you’re travelling home by taxi or ride share choose a pick up location away from the stadium to avoid traffic delays.

NRL: Panthers v Storm at BlueBet Stadium. Kick-off at 8pm, full time approx. 10pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on Mulgoa Rd, Jamison Rd and Jane St/Great Western Hwy through Penrith as fans travel to the stadium in the busy Friday evening peak.

Motorists should allow extra time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

Cirque du Soleil at Qudos Bank Arena from Thursday 3 to Sunday 13 August.

Allow extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Traffic will be heavier than usual and parking in high demand as families travel to the venue for the shows, especially during evening peak times.

Fans are encouraged to arrive early and pre-book parking online ahead of time, available until 11:59pm the night before the event.

Please note, Sydney Olympic Park will be extremely busy on Saturday 12 August with up to 75,000 football fans expected at the FIFA Women’s World Cup 2023™ Quarter Final match at neighbouring Stadium Australia. Cirque du Soleil attendees must pre-book parking online to secure a space if driving to the show and should also expect delays and allow plenty of extra travel time.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.otherAdvice:
AFL: GWS Giants v Swans at GIANTS Stadium. First bounce at 7:30pm, finish approx 22:10pm.

Traffic will be heavy on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd as crowds travel to and from the match at the same time Cirque du Soleil takes place at neighbouring Qudos Bank Arena.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority may close some local roads to accommodate increased public transport services and ensure pedestrian safety during events. For road closure details, visit Sydney Olympic Park Authority and check out the interactive map.

Fans are encouraged to arrive early and pre-book parking online ahead of time, available until 11:59pm the night before the event or until sold out

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.otherAdvice:
Luke Combs at Qudos Bank Arena on Wednesday 16 and Thursday 17 August.

Allow extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Traffic will be heavier than usual and parking in high demand as attendees travel to the venue during evening peak times.

Fans are encouraged to arrive early and pre-book parking online ahead of time, available until 11:59pm the night before the event.

Please note, Sydney Olympic Park will be extremely busy on Wednesday 16 August with up to 75,000 football fans expected at the FIFA Women’s World Cup 2023™ Semi Final match at neighbouring Stadium Australia. Luke Combs attendees must pre-book parking online to secure a space if driving to the show and should also expect delays and allow plenty of extra travel time.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.otherAdvice:
One Fine Baby Expo at Hordern Pavilion on Saturday 5 and Sunday 6 August. From 9am to 3pm daily.

Motorists should allow extra travel time on roads approaching and around Moore Park including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

Please note, Moore Park will be extremely busy on Sunday 6 August with up to 40,000 football fans expected at the FIFA Women’s World Cup 2023™ match at nearby Sydney Football Stadium. Expo attendees are strongly encouraged to consider catching public transport. Parking at the precinct will be extremely limited with both Driver Ave grass car parks closed to the public on Sunday 6 August.

Local closures will be in place on Sunday 6 Augut to safely manage crowds:

  • Driver Avenue will be partially closed from 9am and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area after the game at SFS.
  • Moore Park Rd and Fitzroy St cycleway will temporarily close from 9am to 4pm before, during and after the game at the SFS. See the cycleway detour map (pdf 349KB).

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 8am until 4pm on Sunday 6 August  including sections of Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.Roosters v

properties.publicTransport: Travel on transport is included in match tickets. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL Roosters Double Header at the SCG. NRLW v Dragons from 5:40pm. NRL v Sea Eagle kick-off at 7:50pm, full time around 9:50pm.

Motorists should allow extra travel time on roads approaching and around Moore Park including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd. Traffic will be heavy in the busy Thursday evening peak.

Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 3:30pm and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area after the game.

No through-traffic will be available on Driver Ave. Access to EP3 grass car park and drop off areas maintained from Lang Rd. EP2 will not be open for this match.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 3pm until 11pm including sections of Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.otherAdvice:
Significant road closures and widespread parking restrictions will be in place between the Sydney CBD and Bondi Beach while up to 80,000 people take part in the 14km City 2 Surf fun run.

Roads close from 3.30am in the city, with major closures along the course from 6am between Woolloomooloo and Edgecliff and from 7am between Double Bay and Bondi. Roads start reopening from 11.30am in the city then between 1pm and 2pm in the east. Roads at Bondi Beach remain closed until 4pm.

MAJOR ROAD CLOSURES

  • Sydney CBD between 3.30am and 12pm: sections of College St, Macquarie St, St James Rd, Park St and William St.
  • Woolloomooloo to Edgecliff from 6am to 12pm: William St from Yurong St through to New South Head Rd at Ocean Ave. No access to the city via New South Head Rd west of Ocean St until 12pm, alternate route via Oxford St.
  • Double Bay to Rose Bay from 7am to 1pm: New South Head Rd from Ocean Ave to Dover Rd.
  • Rose Bay to North Bondi from 7am to 2pm: New South Head Rd from Dover Rd to Old South Head Rd, Old South Head Rd from New South Head Rd to Oceanview Ave and Military Rd from Old South Head Rd to Blair St.
  • Bondi Beach between 6am and 4pm: Campbell Pde between Francis St and Hall St from 7am.
  • Bondi Junction from 9am to 3:30pm: sections of Grafton St, Grosvenor St and Oxford St. Bondi Rd will also be heavily congested with hundreds of buses transporting thousands of participants between the beach and the junction. Motorists are strongly encouraged to avoid unnecessary travel on Bondi Rd.

**Local closures will be in effect on Warners Ave, North Bondi, and O’Sullivan Rd Rose Bay from 4pm the day before the event and will remain closed until 4pm on Sunday 13 August. Special Event Clearways will be in place at these locations.


Vehicle crossover points will be maintained at specific locations along the course until 7am and 7.15am, once the course is locked down there is no vehicle crossing until roads reopen. It is a fineable offence to drive on or exit a driveway onto a closed road. Pedestrian crossing is permitted when there are safe gaps between runners.

Special event clearway parking restrictions will be in effect along both sides of the entire 14km course this year from 1am to 12pm from the city to Rose Bay and from 1am until 4pm along the remainder of the course to Bondi Beach. If your car is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and also apply to local residents with parking permits and TfNSW Mobility Scheme permit holders. Check signs carefully on the day and the night before as vehicles left in signposted clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.title: Special Event Clearways

arrangementElements.html:
Vehicle course crossover points:

Crossover points along the course will be maintained for local access until 7am or 7.15am, depending on the location. After these times there will be no vehicle access permitted while the run is underway until roads have safely reopened to traffic. 

  • Woolloomooloo/Darlinghurst: Crown St at William St two-way crossover open until 7:15am
  • Darling Point: Exit only one-way from New Beach Rd at New South Head Rd open until 7am
  • Double Bay: Exit only one-way from Cross St to Bellevue Rd until 7:15am
  • Vaucluse: Towns Rd / Vaucluse Rd at New South Head Rd two-way crossover open until 7:15am
  • Vaucluse/Watsons Bay: Exit only one-way from Old South Head Rd at New South Head Rd until 7:15am
  • North Bondi/Bondi Beach: Exit only one-way from Brighton Blvd and Ramsgate Ave at Campbell Pde open until 7am 

Note: Access to Cross City Tunnel and Craigend St (westbound direction only) is maintained via McLachlan Ave at Rushcutters Bay


Local access

Bondi Rd will be heavily congested with hundreds of buses transporting thousands of participants between the beach and the junction. Local residents are strongly encouraged to avoid unnecessary travel on Bondi Rd.

Residents north of Bondi Rd should use Old South Head Rd to enter or exit the area. Residents south of Bondi Rd should use Birrell St. Local access for residents at Bondi Beach will be maintained via Curlewis, Gould and Hall Streets - no exit onto Lamrock Ave.

properties.otherAdvice:
Over 100,000 people are expected to attend the Ferragosto Italian Street Festival in Five Dock on Sunday 20 August, from 10am to 5pm.

Road closures and special event clearway parking restrictions will be in place for the festival.

Great North Road will be closed between Queens Road and Lyons Road from 3am until 11pm.

Motorists will be diverted around the closure via Lyons Road, Ingham Avenue, Fairlight Street, Queens Road and Harris Road.

Special event clearways will be in effect from 2am to 11pm on both sides of Great North Road between Queens Road and Lyons Road, as well as on sections of surrounding streets.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.otherAdvice:
The Casino Truck Show will be held on Saturday 5 August in the CBD of Casino from 9.30am to 12.00pm. The parade will commence at 10am along Johnston Street and Centre Street. Johnston Street at Cassino Drive will have speed restrictions, traffic control and Police in place, stopping general traffic flow for up to 10 minutes to allow the parade to proceed. The following local roads will be closed from 5am to 6pm:

  • Barker Street – from the intersection of Centre Street to Hickey Street
  • Walker Street – from River Street to Pratt Street
  • Canterbury Street – east of Domino’s driveway to the west of Coles car park driveway
  • Richmond Street – from the intersection of Walker Street to Graham Place
  • Graham Place – from the intersection of Walker Street to the Aldi car park driveway
properties.diversions: Summerland Way traffic from Fairy Hill or Kyogle heading towards Grafton or Mallanganee will detour via Farley Street, Colches Street and Richmond Street. Bruxner Highway traffic from Lismore heading towards Grafton or Mallanganee will detour via West Street and Richmond Street.
